result.execSummary:
The defendant Alecia D Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $250 bond applied; balance is $721.  Court granted payment plan of $25/mo commencing 10/01/16.  Failure to make payments when due will result in 1 day in the Ozaukee Co Jail for every $25 outstanding.
Defendant must submit to a DNA sample at the Ozaukee Co Jail

Defendant Alecia D Williams in court with attorney Robert P Olmr.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Alecia D Williams in court with attorney Robert P Olmr.  Shannon Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Olmr requests adjournment for defendant to obtain valid dl.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on August 1, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Alecia D Williams in court with attorney Robert P Olmr.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea of not gulity plea entered. Atty. Olmr recently assigned case, defendant attempting to obtain her driver's license.  Further proceedings scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Atty. Robert Olmr will accept court appointment. Copy of complaint/def phone # and court notice forwarded to Atty. Olmr.
Payment at a rate of $100 per month commencing June 1st, 2016 and continuing on the 1st day of each month thereafter.  Appointment of counsel pending.

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Further proceedings on June 15, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Alecia D Williams in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel advises court that defendant that defendant no longer qualifies and State Public Defender cannot represent on newly acquired misdemeanor case.  Court advises defendant of rights to an attorney.  Defendant submits petition for court appointed attorney.  Court reviews the petition, relieves the State Public Defender, and appoints an attorney.  Further proceedings scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Court is informed defendant does qualify for the public defender. Plea of not guilty entered. Court orders $250 signature bond w/condition. Further proceedings scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
